Sentencas: A novel high-temperature alkaline earth silicate sealing glass was developed for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) applications.
Titulo: Effect of aluminizing of Cr-containing ferritic alloys on the seal strength of a novel high-temperature solid oxide fuel cell sealing glass

Sentencas: The glass was used to join two metallic coupons of Cr-containing ferritic stainless steel for seal strength evaluation.
Titulo: Effect of aluminizing of Cr-containing ferritic alloys on the seal strength of a novel high-temperature solid oxide fuel cell sealing glass

Sentencas: In previous work, SrCrO4 was found to form along the glass/steel interface, which led to severe strength degradation.
Titulo: Effect of aluminizing of Cr-containing ferritic alloys on the seal strength of a novel high-temperature solid oxide fuel cell sealing glass

Sentencas: aluminization of the steel surface was investigated as a remedy to minimize or prevent the strontium chromate formation.
Titulo: Effect of aluminizing of Cr-containing ferritic alloys on the seal strength of a novel high-temperature solid oxide fuel cell sealing glass

Sentencas: Three different processes for aluminization were evaluated with Crofer22APU stainless steel: pack cementation, vapor-phase deposition.
Titulo: Effect of aluminizing of Cr-containing ferritic alloys on the seal strength of a novel high-temperature solid oxide fuel cell sealing glass
Effect of aluminizing of Cr-containing ferritic alloys on the seal strength of a novel high-temperature solid oxide fuel cell sealing glass

Sentencas: It was found that pack cementation resulted in a rough surface with occasional cracks in the Al-diffused region.
Titulo: Effect of aluminizing of Cr-containing ferritic alloys on the seal strength of a novel high-temperature solid oxide fuel cell sealing glass

Sentencas: Vapor-phase deposition yielded a smoother surface, but the resulting high Al content increased the coefficient of thermal expansion (CTE), resulting in the failure of joined coupons.
Titulo: Effect of aluminizing of Cr-containing ferritic alloys on the seal strength of a novel high-temperature solid oxide fuel cell sealing glass

Sentencas: Aerosol spraying of an Al-containing salt resulted in the formation of a thin aluminum oxide layer without any surface damage.
Titulo: Effect of aluminizing of Cr-containing ferritic alloys on the seal strength of a novel high-temperature solid oxide fuel cell sealing glass

Sentencas: The room temperature seal strength was evaluated in the as-fired state and in environmentally aged conditions.
Titulo: Effect of aluminizing of Cr-containing ferritic alloys on the seal strength of a novel high-temperature solid oxide fuel cell sealing glass

Sentencas: In contrast to earlier results with uncoated Crofer22APU, the aluminized samples showed no strength degradation even for samples aged in air.
Titulo: Effect of aluminizing of Cr-containing ferritic alloys on the seal strength of a novel high-temperature solid oxide fuel cell sealing glass

Sentencas: Interfacial and chemical compatibility was also investigated.
Titulo: Effect of aluminizing of Cr-containing ferritic alloys on the seal strength of a novel high-temperature solid oxide fuel cell sealing glass

Sentencas: The results showed aluminization to be a viable candidate approach to minimize undesirable chromate formation between alkaline earth silicate sealing glass and Cr-containing interconnect alloys for SOFC applications.
